page.title: 08Housing in Shiskine
page.content:
The number of houses in the Shiskine valley has increased rapidly in the last twenty years. This means there has been an increase in population.
{Most houses are owner-occupied.}There are a few rented council houses left - most of the others were sold to the tenants in the 1980's.
Quite a number of the bungalows in Shiskine are owned by people who live on the mainland: these houses are only used during holiday months. The{modern {houses are mostly frame built houses {with roughcast finish and tiled roofs. {} The{older houses are built of stone {with slate roofs.}Most of these were built around the beginning of this century and are similar in appearance.
